mlp

Class MathTerm

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.MathTerm

  • public class MathTerm
extends java.lang.Object
    Models a mathematical term as a tagged term. Tags can be named or unnamed; when named, they are called features. One of the unnamed tags is considered as the primary tag; other unnamed tags are viewed as secondary tags/attributes. The named tags, i.e., features, are name-value pairs. Certain features "go together", depending on a number of factors, such as the sub-area of math that the term is used in, or the role that the term plays (e.g., "operation", "function", etc.). For that reason, each subset of features that go together under certain scenarios are grouped as a FeatureSet object. In other terms, a MathTerm object models a mathematical term by capturing the name of the term, its primary tag, zero or more secondary tags, zero or more named features, and zero or more alternative feature-sets. Furthermore, the object records the first font action taken on the modeled term, where a "font action" is any change to the font typeface/weight/style of the underlying term, or any accents that got applied to the term.

      • MathTerm

        public MathTerm(java.lang.String term,
                java.lang.String... tags)
        Constructs a MathTerm object for the provided term and with the provided tags.
        Parameters:
        term - the mathematical term being modeled
        tags - zero or more unnamed tags. The first tag is considered the primary tag, and any remaining tags are considered secondary tags.

      • isNamedFeature

        public boolean isNamedFeature(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String value)
        Indicates whether the specified (key,value) pair is an actual (feature name, feature value) pair of the underlying object.
        Parameters:
        key - a potential feature name for the underlying math term
        value - a potential value for the specified feature
        Returns:

      • getFeatureValue

        public java.lang.String getFeatureValue(java.lang.String featureName)
        returns the value of the specified feature name, if it exists.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • addNamedFeature

        public boolean addNamedFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                               java.lang.String featureValue)
        Inserts the feature featureName-featureValue pair if the specified feature name is not null and no feature with the specified name already exists. Otherwise, this new name-value pair will not be inserted, and the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be added
        featureValue - the value of the feature to be added
        Returns:
        true if (1) the specified feature does not exist, (2) its name is not null, and 93) the feature was inserted successfully

      • setNamedFeature

        public java.lang.String setNamedFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                                        java.lang.String featureValue)
        Inserts the feature featureName-featureValue pair if no feature with the specified name already exists. If a feature with the same name already exists, this method changes the value of that feature to the specified value. If the specified feature name is null, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be set
        featureValue - the value of the feature to be set
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for the key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with the key, if the implementation supports null values.)

      • removeNamedFeature

        public java.lang.String removeNamedFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Removes the specified feature if it exists. If the feature does not exist, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be removed
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified feature name, or null if there was no mapping for it.

      • loadFeatureSets

        public void loadFeatureSets(Lexicon lex)
        Loads a list of alternative feature sets for the underlying math term from the specified Lexicon lex.
        Parameters:
        lex - the Lexicon from which alternative feature sets are loaded for the underlying math term.

      • setAlternativeFeatureSets

        public void setAlternativeFeatureSets(java.util.List<FeatureSet> featureSets)
        Sets the alternative feature sets of the underlying math term object to the specified list of FeatureSet objects.
        Parameters:
        featureSets - the list of FeatureSet objects to which the feature sets of the underlying math term object are set.

      • getNamedFeatureSet

        public FeatureSet getNamedFeatureSet(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the first named Feature Set that has the specified name. If the underlying term does not have the specified Feature Set, null is returned. If, on the other hand, the underlying term has multiple Feature Sets with the same name, the first such Feature Set encountered is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the desired Feature Set
        Returns:
        the underlying term's Feature Set object that has the specified name. If the underlying term has no such Feature Set, it returns null. If it has multiple Feature Sets with the same name, the first such Feature Set encountered is returned.

      • isTag

        public boolean isTag(java.lang.String maybeTag)
        Checks if the specified input parameter is one of the tags (primary or secondary).
        Parameters:
        maybeTag - the name to check if it is a primary/secondary tag of the underlying MathTerm object.
        Returns:
        true if the parameter is one of the tags (primary or secondary)

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Indicates if the underlying object is void of any terms and any tags and features.
        Returns:
        true if the term is null or blank, and all the tags, attributes features, and alternative feature sets are empty.

      • firstFontAction

        public java.lang.String firstFontAction()
        Returns the first non-null font-action that was ever successfully applied to this object.
        Returns:
        the first non-null font-action that was ever successfully applied to this object. If no font-action was ever successfully applied to this object, this method returns null.

      • wasFontActionApplied

        public boolean wasFontActionApplied()
        Returns:
        true if a prior font action was successfully applied.

      • setFontAction

        public boolean setFontAction(java.lang.String fontAction)
        Sets the font-action of this object to the specified action if the specified action is not null and if no prior font action was applied.
        Parameters:
        fontAction - the font-action to be recorded as applied on this object.
        Returns:
        true if the specified font-action is not null and if no prior font action was applied. Otherwise, it returns false.
